Package controller

Class CustomerScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.CustomerScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomerScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the CustomerScreen.fxml document and is not meant to be instantiated. This class populates the data for the Customers table, as well as provide the functionality for the buttons on the page.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Gregory Farrell

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called by the FXMLLoader.load() call contained in the toCustomerScreen() method of the UserHomeScreenController class. The method populates the table with all of the Customer data that is in the database.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      resourceBundle - An unreferenced ResourceBundle object passed automatically
      url - An unreferenced URL object passed automatically

    • onAddCustomer

      public void onAddCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      /** This method is an event handler on the New Customer button. When clicked, the button redirects the program toe the AddModifyCustomerScreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the New Customer button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • onModifyCustomer

      public void onModifyCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      /** This method is an event handler on the Modify Customer button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AddModifyCustomerScreen and passes the data from the highlighted Customer. If no Customer is selected an alert will notify the user they must select a Customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Modify Customer button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file.

    • onDeleteCustomer

      public void onDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      /** This method is an event handler on the Delete Customer button. When clicked, an alert will pop up asking the User to verify that they wish to delete the Customer and all associated Appointments. Upon confirmation, the Customer will be deleted from the database and the display table updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Delete Customer button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Exception gets thrown if the SQL code does not compute properly.

    • toUserHomeScreen

      public void toUserHomeScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler for the Back button that sends the program back to the UserHomeScreen. The method loads the FXML document for the UserHomeScreen, passes that to a new scene and then sets the stage with the new scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Back button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The FXMLLoader.load() call will throw this exception if the FXML document can't be found.
